reviews.review_msg: This class discusses many current and interesting topics. Professor Dossa possesses a lot of knowledge about these topics and she teaches with enthusiasm. She encourages students to voice their opinions and to actively participate in class. This class consists of mandatory seminars, group presentations, papers and weekly readings.
Is sweet, but is a poor teacher. Prepared to be bored out of your mind, I was.

Fantastic class, Parin is genuinly interested in what she teaches. She is inspirational and help you to be a critical thinker. there is a lot of group works for her classes and particpation really matters for this class.

NO EXAMS, you have to attend each class to get participation marks, about 3 papers and marks reasonably, a lot of reading which you use for you papers, but she doesn't check if you have read it all. Watch alot of movies, so easy going class, not that stressful, have fun..she is helpful and nice.

She really loves what she teaches, and is incredibly knowledgable and perceptive. The group work can get tedious, but I think she is just trying to teach creatively. If you're interested in the course material, you will love the class.

She requires group work but what this class does is prepare you for the real world-where you might even have to work with other (!) Her biases are apparent but that is why students who enjoy actually engaging with interesting material and don't mind dialogue should enrol..you grade will fairly reflect your effort.

She has all good intentions and truly loves what she teaches.  However, her teaching style doesn't seem to be polished.  She assigns a lot of group work and has NO EXAMS.( good stuff) I did not read the texts and bluffed my book review, as well as forgot to hand in references on my paper and still got a B.
A little unclear on assignments (ie. journaling) and too much group work!
